Text-Image Coherence.definition: The image visually depicts the main concept, object, or scenario that the question is asking about. It shows what needs to be seen to understand the question topic.
Text-Image Coherence.note: Does the image show the thing the question is asking about? Ignore whether text or results are visible in the image.
evaluation_questions: What is the main subject/concept the question is asking about?
Does this image show that subject/concept visually?
Would seeing this image help someone understand what the question refers to?

input.question: What type of animal is shown in the picture?
What is the capital of France?

output.reasoning: The image shows a dog, but the question asks about France's capital.

Standard Presentation.definition: Text and objects appear in normal, expected orientation. Text is horizontal and readable left-to-right. Objects appear right-side up as people normally see them.
Standard Presentation.note: Is everything oriented the way people expect to see it?
evaluation_questions: Is any text in the image horizontal and easy to read?
Are objects shown in their normal, upright position?
Do you need to rotate your head to understand anything?

input.question: What type of vehicle is shown?
input.image: [A car shown upright with any labels in horizontal text]

input.question: What type of vehicle is shown?
input.image: [A car shown upside down with diagonal text]

output.reasoning: The car is upside down and text is diagonal, making recognition harder.

Contrast Clarity.definition: Important visual elements stand out clearly from their background through strong light/dark differences, making everything easy to see and distinguish.
Contrast Clarity.note: Can you easily see and distinguish all important parts of this image?
evaluation_questions: Are there clear differences between light and dark areas?
Can you easily distinguish different elements from backgrounds?
Is any text easy to read against its background?

input.question: What does the diagram show?
input.image: [Black text on a white background with clear element separation]

input.question: What is the label for the red bar?
input.image: [Light gray text on a white background that's hard to read]

output.reasoning: Low contrast between text and background makes it difficult to read.

Visual Clarity.definition: The image focuses on essential elements without unnecessary visual clutter, decorations, or distracting elements that don't serve a purpose.
Visual Clarity.note: Is this image focused and free from visual distractions?
evaluation_questions: Are there any visual elements that seem unnecessary or distracting?
Can you focus easily on important parts without confusion?
Does every visible element serve a clear purpose?

input.question: How many triangles are in the figure?
input.image: [A clean geometric figure with only the relevant triangular shapes]

input.question: How many triangles are in the figure?
input.image: [Triangular shapes mixed with decorative patterns, gradients, and unrelated icons]

output.reasoning: Unnecessary decorative elements distract from counting the triangles.
